Silent deaths among Gaza's sick and wounded denied medical evacuation
subhead: More than 18,000 residents of the Palestinian enclave are waiting to be transferred to hospitals abroad. Because of Israel's blockade and the limited willingness of Western countries to accept patients, around 1,000 have already died.

title: US Supreme Court allows Texas to use redrawn voting map favoring Republicans in 2026
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: Large-scale study confirms Covid-19 vaccine's safety and effectiveness
In Sweden, Lawen Redar embodies the Social Democrats' shift on immigration and integration
subhead: Born in Sweden to Kurdish parents, the MP and party spokesperson on integration advocates for a restrictive migration policy, coupled with strict conditions for residents of foreign origin, who make up 20% of the population.

title: 'With his series 'The American Revolution,' director Ken Burns warns against the tendency to judge the heroes of the past through the lens of the present'
subhead: In a spectacular documentary, the filmmaker advocates for a nuanced and diverse understanding of the history of the American War of Independence against the British Crown – a perspective that does not sit well with all Republicans, explains Le Monde's Corine Lesnes.

title: Michelle Pfeiffer upends the Christmas spirit in 'Oh. What. Fun.'
subhead: Directed by Michael Showalter, this family comedy with an all-star cast partially upends the clichés of the Christmas movie.

title: 'Trump wants to deal a blow to the BBC by pressing on with his lawsuit'
subhead: Claiming he was defamed by the deceptive editing of one of his speeches in a 2024 documentary, the US president is seeking between $1 billion and $5 billion in damages from the British Broadcasting Corporation, observes Le Monde columnist Alain Frachon.

Iran's independent cinema in full revolt: 'With Woman, Life, Freedom, a major barrier was broken'
subhead: Galvanized by the movement that emerged after the death of Mahsa Amini in September 2022, more and more filmmakers are dating to shoot outside any official framework. In a country where film production is a state matter, their films, made and distributed clandestinely, show Iranian society as it really is.

title: France faces legal action for failing to do its 'fair share' in reducing global greenhouse gas emissions
subhead: An advocacy group has called on France's highest administrative court to recognize that France is not doing enough to fight climate change, given its historical responsibility and financial capacity.

title: Influential study on glyphosate safety retracted 25 years after publication
subhead: A 2000 study that concluded the well-known herbicide glyphosate was safe, widely cited since then, has just been officially disavowed by the journal that published it. The scientists are suspected of having signed a text actually prepared by Monsanto.
